text: The Argument from nonbelief is a philosophical argument that says that God probably does not exist. If God did exist, and wanted humans to know it, he would show himself, or make it otherwise clear to all that he existed. Since he has not yet done so, he probably does not exist. == An argument from reasonable nonbelief == A formal argument is as follows: == References == Category:Philosophy Category:Religion Category:Critical thinking
title: Argument from nonbelief
